description: This course offers a sociological understanding of Thailand, focusing on Thai culture and the institutions of education, religion, and economy, drawing partly on guest lecturers and visits to Thai sites. It also provides beginning skills and experience in ethnography — social scientific observation and interpretation of interactions in "the field" — for example, among Thai students, monks, and vendors and customers in markets. Offered during Interim.
name: Thailand: Culture, Inst
notes: This is an off-campus course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
title: Thailand: Culture, Institutions, and Interactions
